metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw in grub2 was found where its configuration file, known as grub.cfg, is being created with the wrong permission set allowing non privileged users to read its content. This represents a low severity confidentiality issue, as those users can eventually read any encrypted passwords present in grub.cfg. This flaw affects grub2 2.06 and previous versions. This issue has been fixed in grub upstream but no version with the fix is currently released.

criterions.comment: grub2 package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-signed package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-unsigned package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
